text.p: The German engineering group Mannesmann AG said on Friday that Cletus von Pichler, an exeuctive at Mannesmann Demag AG, would become management board chairman of Krauss-Maffei AG on January 1.
Von Pichler, 53, will replace Burkhard Wollschlaeger, who steps down at the end of 1996 after ten years at the helm of the plastics and defense firm.
A Mannesmann employee since 1974, von Pichler is responsible for Demag's compressor business. Mannesmann's supervisory board is expected to approve von Pichler at a November 28 meeting.

Wollschlaeger, 63, decided to leave Krauss-Maffei this summer after Mannesmann took complete control of it. Mannesmann increased its Krauss-Maffei stake to 97 percent last year and announced plans to buy the remaining three percent in July.
